newsitem.title: MEXICO: Du Pont de Mexico says to invest up to $350 mln.
newsitem.headline: Du Pont de Mexico says to invest up to $350 mln.

text.p: DuPont Co unit Du Pont de Mexico plans to invest up to $350 million by the end of the decade in exisiting business and new projects, said company vice president Amado Cavazos.

"We have projected investments during the next four years of between $200 and $350 million for all business in Mexico and new business comtemplated," Cavazos told reporters during the eighteenth National Forum of the Chemical Industry in Mexico City. He said a portion of the investment is planned for "low-level" participation in the government's petrochemical plant sale.
